rule: If demand is high and supply is low then increase expedited shipping priority
If port congestion exceeds 75% then reroute to alternative port
If delivery window missed and customer priority is high then trigger expedited refund process
If weather conditions deteriorate and cargo is fragile then select covered transport mode
If fuel costs increase by more than 15% then adjust route calculations accordingly
If customs clearance time exceeds 48 hours then activate priority processing
If carrier reliability drops below 80% then reduce allocation weight
If African corridor disruption detected then activate continental backup routes
If shipment value exceeds $50000 then mandate security escort protocols
If last-mile delivery fails twice then escalate to management intervention
